reporting-org.narrative: Organisation des Nations unies pour l'éducation, la science et la culture (UNESCO)
United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO)

title.narrative: Local communities, indigenous peoples and SIDS Member States have increased their capacity to mobilize their knowledge

description.narrative: CILAC brings development actors together to discuss and build a common vision, new joint projects, programmes, and actions that utilizes the power of science to connect actors, policy instruments and solutions to meet the 2030 Agenda challenges at a regional level. CILAC 2020 in Argentina will focus on inclusion, a topic very relevant for the Right to Science Agenda, and for Indigenous Communities. This event will provide a platform for discussion, focusing on several concrete areas in which UNESCO is working to operationalize these ideals, especially ways in which UNESCO is facilitating discussions on the right to science in Latin America; UNESCO's work on access to information and encouraging knowledge societies and UNESCO's work with Indigenous Peoples.

organisation.narrative: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO)
